page.title: 04PARK FARM
page.content: In the 17th century, Park Farm was a Deer Park. The land was drained about 100 years ago and Mr Alston's father came there in 1932. It is 1100 acres, one of several of that size in the area. The farm buildings are modern, but interesting. The first is a concrete structure which incorporates a renovated 200 year old barn and was built in the 1960s. It is a corn barn and will be 8 feet high with corn in September, bins are not used. The second building (1960s) is of clear span construction and used for cattle. The third (1955) incorporates a traditional type granary. This is used to store machinery.
